attributes.additional_details: Homeowners, single parents & the disabled will be hardest hit on average two in five households will be £52 a Week worse of they include 750,000 households on disability benifit and 600,000 working single parents. Around 2.8 million homes will see these cuts. Tax credits will also be badly hit with around £42 a week worse of. About 750.000 disability benefits will be worse of on average of £76 a week. Also families with more than 2 children born before April 2017 will be worse of by £40 per week
attributes.background: Universal credit is set to replace jsa, esa, child benefit etc, with this taking affect there will be millions affected but this change and mostly all households will be worse of upto £80 a week wosre of
